result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel J. Wagner was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Delivery of Methamphetamine, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(e)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If Probation or Extended Supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Consecutive to: Prison sentence in 16CF202, 15CF1066 and 15CF1314, but concurrent to Probation sentence in 15CF1093.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant not to consume/use/possess any illegal substances/street drugs/non-prescribed drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No contact with J.D., M.B., A.P., RCU, D.D., B.K., or any known drug dealers/users.

Any conditions/programming per agent.
Provide DNA sample and pay surcharge.
Must give a complete and truthful statement to WCDTF/Chippewa Falls Law Enforcement about any illegal activity within his knowledge.  Must testify truthfully in any proceedings against any implicated individuals.  Truthfulness in his statement and/or testimony would be subject to a polygraph if the State deems necessary.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
